Job Title:  Creative Strategist Role Overview:  As a creative strategist, you will be responsible for developing innovative and effective strategies to meet clients' marketing objectives. You will collaborate closely with clients, account managers, creative teams, and other stakeholders to conceptualize, develop, and implement creative campaigns that resonate with target audiences and drive business results. Responsibilities: Strategic Planning:  Develop and execute comprehensive strategic plans that align with clients' overall marketing objectives and target audience insights. Creative Conceptualization:  Generate and develop creative concepts, ideas, and campaign themes that effectively communicate clients' brand messages and value propositions. Market Research:  Conduct thorough market research, including competitor analysis, consumer behavior studies, and trend analysis, to identify opportunities and inform      campaign strategies. Client Collaboration:  Work closely with clients to understand their business goals, challenges, and brand identity, and provide strategic guidance and recommendations to achieve desired outcomes. Campaign Development:  Lead the development of integrated marketing campaigns across various channels, including traditional media, digital platforms, social media, experiential      marketing, and more. Cross-Functional Collaboration:  Collaborate with internal teams, including account      management, creative, media planning, and analytics, to ensure seamless execution of campaigns and alignment with client objectives. Measurement and Analysis:  Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the success of campaigns, analyze performance data, and provide insights and recommendations for optimization. Presentation and Communication:  Prepare and deliver compelling presentations to clients, stakeholders, and internal teams to communicate campaign strategies, creative concepts, and performance results effectively. Industry Trends:  Stay  abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in advertising, marketing, and creative strategy, and leverage insights to drive innovation and differentiation. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising, communications, or a related field (masters      degree preferred). Proven experience (typically 5+ years) in a creative strategy, strategic planning, or similar role within an advertising agency, events agency, marketing firm, or corporate marketing department. Strong understanding of marketing principles, consumer behaviour, branding, and creative      storytelling. Excellent strategic thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Exceptional creativity and ability to think outside the box. Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects      simultaneously and meet tight deadlines. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas      clearly and persuasively. Proficiency in industry-standard software and tools for market research, data analysis, and presentation (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, Google Analytics, etc.). Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. A passion for creativity, innovation, and driving impactful results through strategic thinking and collaboration.
column11: creative strategist, Concept Generation, Ideation, Art Direction, Creative Thinking, story-teller, Concept Development, Brand Strategy, Content Strategy, Creative Solutions, Creative Direction, Creative, Events, Conceptualization

column2: The Video Creative/Asset Manager will participate in the creation of the marketing video content requests,      creating content that will be shared across our organic and paid channels, as we'll as internal communications             They will also manage the archival and retrieval of all video assets created, keeping our Video Library up-to-date and easy to use     Sales tax can be a dry topic, so an engaging and dynamic approach         both in tone and form          is an important success factor     We are looking for a dynamic content creator who can make tax compliance engaging     The video team works closely with a variety of marketing groups, so project management, prioritization, and collaboration are key success factors     We actively work on many projects at one time, so we're looking for someone who is self-directed, sets reasonable expectations and communicates them clearly            Job Duties:             Build extensive knowledge in the subject of transactional tax and stay in tune with industry, product, partner community, and the competitive landscape.         Project manage internally produced and vendor produced projects from start to finish         Create many different types of videos, working from a creative brief to a finished product, often working on multiple projects simultaneously.             Example video types include: animated product demos, promotional advertising content using animated graphics, type and illustrations, live-action edits, and remote captured footage/interviews.              Video Asset Manager             Acquire, catalogue, and manage all marketing video      assets collected and created by our team, including the creation of metadata records and policies regarding the creation, storage, preservation, organization, description, and access to these materials         Regularly audit files and usage keeping content and data relevant and accurate         Make content recommendations and distribute assets to internal departments when requested             QUALIFICATIONS             7 years of experience as a video creator, editor and animator.         (2+) years of experience managing digital video assets.         Project management or producing experience.         Strategic marketing work experience (focus on B2B).         Proficient knowledge and experience using the Abode Creative Cloud; including Premiere Pro, After Effects, Audition and Illustrator.         Bachelor of Arts degree in film studies, video production, or related field.                     KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES             Ability to single-handedly create a video, from start to finish, including: script writing/editing, storyboarding, editing and animation, sound design, audio mixing, color correction and file delivery.           Experience working on up to 5 video projects simultaneously, at different stages in the process, and the ability to     prioritize to meet deadlines and goals.               Experience making dry information fun and entertaining, using visual storytelling and creative design,      to increase audience engagement.           Ability to      work effectively with stakeholders to gather and interpret feedback, and clearly collaborate and communicate about production timelines, project delays, and processes.           Skilled at developing and maintaining efficient processes: keeping detailed notes, records, and systems that are simple and effective for increasing work output and minimizing mistakes.              Experience working with collaborative team tools such as: Google Workspace, Microsoft Office Suite, Slack, Jira and/or Workfront.

column2: Requirements: 4+years experience as a Creative Director or in a similar creative leadership role. Strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of successful creative projects Strong project management skills to oversee multiple projects, meet deadlines, and manage resources efficiently. Ability to interact with clients, understand their needs, and present creative concepts that meet client expectations. Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration skills. In-depth knowledge of industry trends, design principles, and creative software. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Need to be outcome oriented and produce deliverables satisfying with the objective given Achieving the desired outcome holds the the highest priority, need to act proactively to achieve it The attitude to always strive for the best outputs and an enthusiasm to craft engaging videos for users. Self-disciplined, self-motivated, flexible, approachable, attentive to detail, and able to manage multiple tasks in a fast-moving work environment. Strong collaboration abilities and a flexible & friendly approach to working with teams. High determination with a constant eye on solutions. Creative ideas with a problem-solving mindset. Should be open to take feedback objectively and reflect them in the next versions Key Responsibilities: Creative Leadership: Develop and articulate a clear and inspiring creative vision for the brand. Provide strong leadership to the creative team, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. Strategic Planning: Define and implement creative strategies that align with overall business goals and marketing objectives. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate creative initiatives into broader business strategies. Team Management: Lead and mentor a team of creative professionals, including graphic designers, copywriters, video editors, animators and cinematographers. Provide guidance, feedback, and support to ensure the team's growth and development. Project Oversight: Oversee multiple projects simultaneously, from concept development to execution, ensuring deadlines and quality standards are met. Collaborate with project managers to allocate resources effectively and manage workflow efficiently. Brand Stewardship: Maintain and evolve the brand identity, ensuring consistency across all creative outputs. Collaborate with marketing and communication teams to align creative efforts with brand strategy. Client Interaction: Act as the primary point of contact for clients regarding creative aspects of projects. Present and pitch creative concepts, incorporating client feedback while preserving the integrity of the creative vision. Innovation and Trends: Stay current on industry trends, emerging technologies, and creative best practices. Infuse innovative ideas into the creative process and encourage a culture of continuous improvement. Budget Management: Ensure resources are allocated efficiently to meet project requirements. Quality Control: Uphold high creative standards and conduct regular reviews to ensure the quality of all creative outputs.. Reporting and Analysis: Analyze the performance and impact of creative campaigns and projects. Provide insights and recommendations for optimization and improvement.  CTC-  18 - 24 LPA Work Location -  Hyderabad   Working Days -  6 days

You can be our Captain America or Thor who saves the universe by satiating client appetite for numerous advertising solutions in a fast-paced environment. Winning pitches, awards and accolades is second nature to you.  You will be the ultimate Master Shifu to our Creative Pandas. In this role you will Don the Hat of a Creative Leader - Provide visionary leadership to the creative team, inspiring excellence and fostering a culture of creativity, collaboration, and innovation. Be a Strategist - Visualize the larger picture and align strategies for the clients. Be design and copy agnostic. Your team will tread the path of client brand guidelines, budget and ask. OR the team creates magic like never before and presents business opportunities for new and existing clients. Partner with Strategy team to bring insights to life. Leadership skills to drive strategic thinking across different teams. You have 15+ years of relevant work experience at a creative/advertising agency or digital agency with a strong portfolio of work. Award winning portfolio with a blend of offline and online. Strong people skills can mentor and lead teams and lead campaigns with minimal escalations. A positive attitude with a smiling demeanor and a great team player who believes in fostering client relationships. Spontaneity with the latest trends and technologies across formats and platforms. column2: Job Title: ACD-Copy (Associate Creative Director - Copywriting) Location: Bengaluru Experience Level: 8-9 years Job Type: Full-Time Reports to: Senior/National Creative Director Job Description The position of ACD-Copy (Associate Creative Director - Copywriting) is a key role within our agency. This individual will be responsible for overseeing the quality and effectiveness of all copywriting work produced by the creative team. The ACD-Copy will play a crucial role in shaping the messaging and tone for various clients or a specific group of clientele. They will provide guidance, feedback, and recommendations to ensure that all copy meets the highest standards of creativity and aligns with client briefs. This role requires a deep understanding of copywriting principles, strong leadership skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. The ACD-Copy must thrive in a fast-paced environment, work well under pressure, and consistently deliver high-quality copy on tight deadlines. Key Responsibilities Copywriting Excellence: Maintain the highest quality standards for all copywriting work, ensuring it effectively communicates the desired message, reflects the brand's voice, and engages the target audience. Team Leadership: Provide guidance, mentorship, and feedback to the copywriting team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment that promotes growth and excellence. Client Collaboration: Collaborate closely with clients to understand their goals, objectives, and target audience, and develop compelling copy that meets their needs. Strategic Thinking: Contribute to the development of creative strategies and concepts, bringing fresh ideas and insights to drive impactful storytelling through copy. Qualifications Minimum of 8-9 years of experience in copywriting or a similar creative field,with a strong background in events. Proven leadership skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a team. Exceptional conceptual and writing abilities, with a keen eye for detail. Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. Prior experience in handling events and campaigns for B2B tech brands is a plus. If you are interested in the role, please share a copy of your resume and portfolio with pujasnavin@hr-central.in  Thanks and regards, Puja Sharma Navin HR Central
column11: Team Handling, Events, Copy Writing, Client Servicing
